{"unique_id": "https://in.linkedin.com/in/harshal-gidh-58b298185", "about": "I am an enthusiastic Data Scientist and Machine Learning Engineer with a Bachelor's degree in Electronics and Telecommunications from MCT Rajiv Gandhi Institute of Technology, Mumbai. My passion for technology and data-driven insights drives my continuous pursuit of knowledge and innovation in the field of data science and Generative AI.

Currently, I am honing my skills as an intern at MResult, where I am involved in a diverse range of projects, including a Wealth Management chatbot that performs functions such as determining the user's investment personality, tax calculation and savings advice, stock price analysis, prediction and advice, and providing financial suggestions based on the user's financial details and investment personality. My work involves integrating AI and ML solutions to deliver accurate predictions, insightful analyses, user-friendly interfaces, and creating pipelines for the models.

During my tenure at MResult, I have successfully implemented complex machine learning models and created pipelines, developed intuitive chatbot features, and contributed to the automation and optimization of various processes. My ability to translate complex technical concepts into actionable insights has been a key asset in my role.

I have also been actively engaged in extracurricular activities such as managing and organizing technical events for IETE and participating in coding challenges and competitions on platforms like LeetCode and GeeksforGeeks. These experiences have not only sharpened my technical skills but also enhanced my leadership and teamwork abilities.

Key Skills:
-Data Science & Machine Learning: Proficient in Python, TensorFlow, PyTorch, and scikit-learn.
-Generative AI: Experienced in developing and fine-tuning models for diverse applications using frameworks and wrapper LLMs such as GPT-3.5, GPT4, Gemini-Pro, FinGPT, and AI models from HuggingFace.
-Software Development: Experienced in developing applications with Flask, Django, and AIogram.
-Databases: Skilled in SQL, MongoDB, ChromaDB, PineconeFAISS and Weaviate.
-Problem-Solving: Consistently solving complex DSA problems and earning recognitions, including the 100 Days Coding 2024 Badge on LeetCode and many Daily LeetCode Challenge of the Month Badges.

I am always eager to connect with like-minded professionals and explore new opportunities in the field of data science, Generative AI, and machine learning. I’m happy to share this Source Code Analysis Using GenAI project I worked on. Check it out here: https://lnkd.in/dbqU6evr 😄 🤖🔍

When referring to GitHub repositories, understanding the code's functionality can be challenging. 🤔 
To address this, I've developed a Source Code Analysis web app powered by GenAI. This app allows users to interact with AI via chat and gain insights into any GitHub repository they're interested in. 😊 

Tech Stack Used:
- Python
- LangChain
- Flask
- Gemini-Pro
- ChromaDB VectorDB

How to Run 🤔 :

Steps:

1. Clone the Repository:
  git clone https://lnkd.in/dxg2M-XT

2. Create a Conda Environment:
  conda create -n llmapp python=3.8 -y
  conda activate llmapp

3. Install Requirements:
  pip install -r requirements.txt

4. Add Google API Key:
  - Create a `.env` file in the root directory.
  - Add your Google API Key credentials:
  GOOGLE_API_KEY = "xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx"
   
5. Start the Application:
  python app.py

6. Access the Web Interface:
  Open your web browser and navigate to `localhost`.

7. Paste GitHub Repository URL:
  Copy and paste the GitHub repository URL you want to examine.

Now you're ready to start chatting with the AI and understand the technical aspects of any GitHub repository! 💬🚀

GitHub Link: https://lnkd.in/dxg2M-XT

Here's a glimpse:

👩‍💻 January
➡ Returned to work with zeal post-marriage.
➡ Completed Development of a groundbreaking algorithm for Face Recognition.

🏆 February
➡ Assembled my dream AI-focused PC. 💻 
➡ Honored with the 'Ultimate Contributor of the Year' award by Weboccult Technologies. 

🏖️ March
➡ Recharged with a serene trip to Goa with Better half.
➡ Celebrated the impactful rollout of our Face Recognition Algorithm for 1,000+ artisans on Laracon India event.

📚 April
➡ Embarked on a journey into Generative AI and LLMs.

⛰️ June
➡ Rejuvenated with a tranquil escape to Abu with Family.

🌐 July
➡ Founded our AI Vision Community AI.
➡ Shared insights on 'Generative AI: Power of Diffusers' on AI Appreciation Day.
➡ Explored the historical Kumbhalgarh with WebOccult Technologies Pvt. Ltd. Family.
➡ Launched the beta version of MemoryLens AI

👥 August
➡ Contributed as a volunteer in the August Chapter of our AI Vision Community.
➡ Initiated an open-source ONNX project on GitHub.

🌳 September
➡ Wandered through Lonavala, Mahabaleshwar, and Mumbai with Friends
➡ Large Campus Drive of 400+ students at Parul University.
➡ Conducted a session on 'Zero to One in Computer Vision' for our AI Vision Community of October.
➡ Showcased our latest AI solutions at #japanitweek and #nextech 

🎉 November
➡ Celebrated my birthday and Diwali in Rajkot with family.
➡ Our Largest virtual off-campus drive for AI/ML talents.
➡ Ranked 19th in Stackoverflow's AI for November Month

🎓 December
➡ Educated students at LJ University about Face Recognition Technology.
➡ Volunteering in the AI Vision Community's December chapter
(Secure your spot here: https://lnkd.in/dwXDh3RT)
➡Achieved #2 in Stackoverflow AI for December and #33 for the year.


As I look back, I am overwhelmed with gratitude towards everyone who's been a part of this journey – colleagues, mentors, friends, and family. Your support and encouragement have been the wind beneath my wings.

🌟 Looking Ahead to 2024

There's still so much to achieve! The horizon of 2024 is beaming with potential. I am excited to dive into new challenges, continue my learning journey, and contribute further to the AI community.
Thank you all for being an integral part of my 2023. Let's step into 2024 with renewed energy and unbridled enthusiasm! 🚀💼🌍

🎉 Thrilled to Share My Experience at the December 2023 Chapter of AI Vision Community India (join here https://lnkd.in/gvw2dFkk) 🌐

Today, I had the wonderful opportunity to volunteer at an insightful seminar hosted by the AI Vision Community India . The event was a convergence of bright minds and innovative ideas, making it a memorable experience.

👁️‍🗨️ The first session, led by the knowledgeable Jaydeep Pedhadiya (Enterprise Level Architect at WebOccult Technologies Pvt. Ltd. ), delved into the #edgecomputing and #fogcomputing. His expertise in the field shone through, offering a deep dive into these #cuttingedgetechnology .

🚀 The second session, presented by Ruchir Kakkad (CEO and CTO at WebOccult Technologies Pvt. Ltd.), was a true eye-opener for developers like me. "AI on the Ground Beyond Reality beyond #aihype" not only expanded our horizons but also emphasized the importance of staying ahead in the fast-evolving tech world. It was a crucial reminder that as developers, we must evolve continuously to ensure that we harness #AI tools effectively, rather than being overshadowed by them.

A big shoutout to IT Path Solutions Pvt. Ltd. for being the fantastic venue partner and facilitating this enriching experience.

As I reflect on today's seminar, I feel enriched and empowered with new knowledge and perspectives. It's events like these that reinforce the importance of community learning and staying at the forefront of technological advancements.

This wasn't just an event; it was a deep dive into how Google Generative AI, Multi-Agent Systems, and Google DeepMind's cutting-edge AI trends are fundamentally reshaping industries.

For me, a standout was the brilliant Gemini live demo by Tiago Henriques, truly showcasing the future of AI. 
The session by Ziad Jammal, Country Manager, Google Cloud - UAE, was incredibly inspiring and thought-provoking – fantastic to finally connect in person and discuss #AITransformation in the maritime industry! 
Also, Alex Rutter's session on the potential of Agents was simply brilliant.
And it was a pleasure to finally meet Mohammed Khodr - MK, Google Cloud AI Lead, in person; always inspiring to connect with you.

On the sidelines, I had a fantastic conversation on Agentic AI and its industry-reshaping potential with Ahmed Afrose, Head of Customer Engineering at Google Cloud. And a truly thought-provoking, long exchange on Vertex AI, the A2A protocol, ADK, GDC, and more with @Pradeep Singh – incredibly insightful!

Getting hands-on with Agent Space Labs and the Agent Development Kit (ADK) with Fabrice Aubert was pure gold – seeing multi-agent systems come to life on GCP is truly powerful.

A clear reminder: We're not waiting for the AI revolution, we're building it.

In smart metering, one of the biggest challenges is Non-Communicating (NonCom) smart meters—devices that fail to transmit data remotely due to network issues, hardware failures, configuration errors, or SIM-related problems. This leads to missing consumption data, inaccurate billing, operational inefficiencies, and increased manual workload for field technicians.

To tackle this, we are developing a DLMS-based Android application that empowers technicians to retrieve meter data on-site using an optical probe connected via OTG USB. 
Excited to bring this transformation to smart metering! 🚀 #SmartMetering #DLMS #IoT #AndroidApp #EnergyTech #Innovation

2.📱 Project Overview
The MeterSnap app is designed to scan and validate electric meter images quickly and accurately using a mobile phone. It helps field teams ensure correct meter identification, avoid duplication, and generate organized reports automatically.To reduce errors, save time, and simplify the process of capturing and recording electric meter data in the field.

"numLikes": 0, "numComments": 0, "reactionTypes": "[]"}, {"postText": "Had a very insightful experience attending this Live Audio event...

Agenda: How to prepare for Tech Roles ?
Hosted By: Priyank Ahuja
Guest: Nikita Sharma

Some points of insight that Nikita Sharma shared:

1. Resume should be crisp (One page), to the point.

2. Make sure your resume consist of most of the keywords that are present in JD of profile you are applying for and should reflect the skills required by the company, always touch-up the resume before applying.

3. Always go for Quality over quantity. Do not try to learn everything that comes on LinkedIn posts or others are achieving. Follow your passion and polish it.

4. When preparing for tech roles, always follow your own path with your goals.

5. Get comfortable giving interviews by practicing with peers, friends or anyone who is ready to do this exercise.

6. Learn from one source and not get confused by following multiple paths together at one instance of time. (Sources : Youtube, Online Learning)

7. Clear concepts first before going for Competitive Programming.

Thanks a lot Priyank Ahuja for organising this event. 
Thanks Nikita Sharma for guiding us about getting ready for tech roles in Tech Giants.

(LLM)", "endorsementCount": 0, "endorsementText": ""}, {"title": "Keras", "endorsementCount": 0, "endorsementText": ""}], "source_file": "modified_2.json", "updates": [{"postText": "How does ResNet50 see the world? 🌍 

On the left: what we see — a typical street.
On the right: what a machine sees — pixel-wise segmentation, with each region mapped to a class label via feature extraction and classification.

⭐ ResNet50, with its 50-layer deep residual blocks and skip connections, doesn’t just "see" — it interprets. It forms the backbone for a wide range of tasks, from semantic segmentation to classification and detection. 

✨ I’m currently applying ResNet50 in a very different context:
leaf-level crop disease analysis. 🌿

The goal: to predict current and potential plant diseases based on visible patterns and deep features, improving early diagnosis and reducing crop losses.

{"unique_id": "https://in.linkedin.com/in/saransh-mehta", "about": "Working with Artificial Intelligence with major focus on Generative AI, Agentic AI systems, Conversational AI and Natural Language Processing.

- synthetic image data generation with Stable Diffusion models using text prompt conditioning
- Docker containers, kubernetes, MLOps CI/CD Pipeline
At Oracle (OCI),

- Filed two patents -> Model architecture for faster inference on GPU, Multi-task learning for Hierarchical NER
- Hierarchical/Nested NER 
- Multilinguality preservation in models using Adapters 
- Data validation and healing pipeline

Built the following components for Conversational Ai system,
- Open-sourced multi-task-NLP toolkit to train and infer single model for multiple tasks. The library builds task specific headers on top of a shared encoder (BERT, ALBERT, RoBERTa, XLNet etc. ) for cross-task knowledge sharing.
- Document information discovery using extractive machine comprehension along with semantic passage candidate generation, passage relevance ranking, answerability detection and expected answer type prediction.

- Given a context passage, using GPT-2 model to generate possible questions and corresponding answers. 
- Self-Supervised Triplet Loss with human annotated feedback for better Word-Embedding clustering.
Multi kernel CNN for text classification.
- Sequence2Sequence modelling for text generation. 
- Dynamic RNN with LSTM for text intent detection/classification,
